results.title: The Birds
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Talk to the animals”.
Enjoy your favourite bird stories as seen on ATN Seven’s “Talk to the animals” series with Dr. Harry Cooper. A plethora of handy hints and essential information for bird owners.

results.title: The Birders
results.creator_credit: David Morgan, John Richardson, Broken Hill Proprietary Company and Kestrel Films (Australia)
results.brief_description: Winner of the 1976 Australian National Travel Association Jedda Award at the Australian Film Awards. The mutton bird industry of the Furneaux Islands (Cape Barren Island and Flinders Island) in Bass Strait is a little known and historic primary industry started by sealers more than 150 years ago. The film records the rugged life style of the small band of people involved in Mutton birding. Narrated by Ross Thompson and photographed by Kevin Anderson. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: The Birdcage
results.creator_credit: Mike Nichols and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: Armand (Robin Williams) and Albert (Nathan Lane) have created their own piece of serenity with their successful nightclub, “The Birdcage”. Armand takes care of the management and Albert performs nightly as the wonderful female impersonator, Starina. Their world is thrown into disarray when Armand’s son announces he is engaged to a conservative Senator’s daughter who is eager to meet their future son in laws parents. It will take all of Albert’s stage experience to convince the future in laws they are a ‘normal’ family. This reworking of the classic French farce ‘La Cage aux Folles’ will delight viewers with it sparkling humour and great performances by Robin Williams, Nathan Lane, Hank Azaria, Gene Hackman, Dianne Wiest, Dan Futterman and Calista Flockhart.

results.title: The Big easy
results.creator_credit: Jim McBride, Stephen J. Friedman and Kings Road Entertainment
results.brief_description: The Big Easy is a sexy thriller romance set in New Orleans. When a member of the mafia is murdered in downtown New Orleans, Remy McSwain (Dennis Quaid) and Anne Osborne (Ellen Barkin) are unwittingly forced together as they pursue the murderer who may or may not be a cop. Barkin’s starchy D.A. prosecutor disapproves of the shady ethical practises of McSwain and his ‘Big Easy’ co-workers, who view bribery as a normal way of life. Remy McSwain, who comes from a large family of New Orleans policemen starts to reevaluate his values and life as he and Osborne become closer. Jim McBride has created a rivetting and fun film which revels in it’s complex characters and in the sizzling chemistry between Dennis Quaid and Ellen Barkin. Ned Beatty and Charles Ludlam are good in supporting roles and the film pulses with great cajun music and a sense of life in New Orleans.

results.title: The Best life
results.creator_credit: Keifer Yu, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Keifer Yu takes us beyond the tourist attractions of Broome, Western Australia, to the cultures therein. Yu focuses on the Indigenous and Chinese cultures of which he is a part. He considers how the differing cultures have enriched his life and how they blend in together in this unique community.

results.title: The Bird who is a clown
results.creator_credit: John Walker and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Introduces the island Daphne Major of the Galapagos Islands which is a small island and nesting ground for hundrreds of Blue-footed Booby birds. Emphasises the mating and upbringing of the young in order to illustrate the development of the Booby and to reveal its behaviour patterns. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: A Story to inspire
results.creator_credit: Tanika Deemal-Parker, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Tanika Deemal-Parker has been singing all her life. She has been encouraged by her mum to take her singing further and, when doubts set in, it was her mum that helped her through with some words of wisdom.

results.title: The Big country (S)
results.creator_credit: William Wyler, Gregory Peck, United Artists Corporation and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: The Big country is a western epic that has it all: a classic story, an all-star cast and the impeccable direction of Academy Award winning veteran, William Wyler. Gregory Peck stars as a sea captain who trades the expanse of the oceans for the open range of the West and grows to regret his choice. Charlton Heston is the menacing ranch foreman who loves the land and has a keen eye on McKay’s fiancee (Carroll Baker). The superlative cast is rounded out by Burl Ives in an Oscar winning role, Jean Simmons, Charles Bickford and Chuck Connors.

results.title: Step by step
results.creator_credit: Sam Kluk, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Sam Kluk loved his beautiful town of Kuranda in Northern Queensland. Unfortunately, there was another side to the quiet town and Kluk was determined to take every opportunity to escape it.
